description: Probably from dialectal fossick (“to ferret out”), fossuck (“troublesome person”), fussick (“to potter over one's work”), fussock (“to bustle about”), further origin uncertain. Compare fuss.

verbs.description: fossick (third-person singular simple present fossicks, present participle fossicking, simple past and past participle fossicked)

definitionGroups.group: (intransitive, Australia, Britain, New Zealand) To search for something; to rummage.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, Australia, Britain, New Zealand, specifically) To elicit information; to ferret out. [from mid 19th c.]
(intransitive, Australia, Britain, New Zealand, specifically) To search for gems, gold, etc., on the surface or in abandoned workings.
